Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-SHf (Phe-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: 50% Phe. Mol Wt: 1076.Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or ML-35p or D21 (MIC 25-100 uM), E.coli ATCC 35218 (MIC >200 uM),  P.aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC >200 uM), Gram-positive S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 12.5 uM), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 50 uM), B. megaterium (MIC 3 ÂµM), yeasts C. albicans ATCC 90028, C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019 (MIC 50 uM), S. cerevisiae (MIC 12.5 uM), fungus A.flavus (MIC >200 uM), parasites L-infantumpromastigotes, and L-infantumamastigotes (MIC >60 uM). Moderately active against MRSA (MIC 25 uM; but not E.coli K12 (MIC >100 uM), S.epidermidis 1457 (MIC>100 uM), and B.subtilis 168 (MIC>100 uM)Mishra et al., 2017).Anticancer as well (Antony et al., 2024). temporin-SHf inhibited A549 cancer cell proliferation and migration.MOA:cancer: it kills cancer cells by triggering caspase-dependent apoptosis through an intrinsic mitochondrial pathway.Structure:  partial helical (residues 3-8) in SDS or DPC micelles.Toxicity: poor hemo.lytic (hRBC HC50 200 uM).Updated 8/2014; Jan2019; 7/2021; 2/2024
Literature Information.Author: Abbassi F, Lequin O, Piesse C, Goasdoue N, Foulon T, Nicolas P, Ladram A.2010
Literature Information.Title: Temporin-SHf, a new type of phe-rich and hydrophobic ultrashort antimicrobial peptide
